Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Kekri remains closed as people protest a.description: AJMER: Kekri town of Ajmer district on Monday witnessed complete closure as people staged protest against health minister Raghu Sharma. They also gave memorandum to sub-divisional officer addressed to the governor where it was alleged that Sharma is taking revenge as Congress candidate Riju Jhunjhunwala lost from Kekri by more than 39,000 votes. The protest started when the state government removed the nagar palika chairman Anil Mittal. BJP came to his rescue and alleged that Congress is doing this to avenge Jhunjhunwala’s defeat. People came out in large numbers to protest against the sitting MLA and minister Raghu Sharma. Massive bandh was witnessed in the town where even medical stores remained shut. BJP staged marches, shouting slogans against Raghu Sharma. Protestors stopped the roadways buses and no taxis or any other form of transport could be seen on the roads. Meanwhile, police remained alert to control any situation during the protest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pre-monsoon showers bring down heat in s.description: JAIPUR: Japurites took a sigh of relief from scorching heat with the moderate pre-monsoon rainfall on Tuesday. The temperature of the Pink City came down to 29.8 degree Celsius on Tuesday from 44 degree Celsius last week when people were reportedly suffering from heat stroke. Jaipur remained one of the ‘coldest’ cities in the state on Tuesday with 13.8 mm rainfall and minimum temperature of 22 degree Celsius. Highest temperature is recorded in Bikaner at 40.8 degree Celsius with zero rainfall. Roads of the Pink City remained clogged on Tuesday with heavy traffic jam and over flowing nullahs were seen around the city. Residents around the city complained that JMC officials were not prepared about the monsoon that will soon knock on the city doors. In next 24 hours there will be light to moderate rain accompanied with thunderstorm with gusty wind (30 - 40 kmph). Maximum and minimum temperature in Jaipur is likely to be around 31 degree Celsius to 24 degree Celsius respectively. Apart from Bikaner, most of the city of Rajasthan recorded zero mm rainfall including Kota, Jaisalmer, Sriganganagar and others. Mercury settled at 35.2 degree Celsius, 35.5 degree Celsius, 36.6 degree Celsius in Ajmer, Jodhpur and Sri Ganganagar respectively. As per the meteorological department, heavy rainfall is likely to occur in isolated places in gRajasthan. Moreover, in East Rajasthan, thunderstorm (30 kmph to 40 kmph) likely to occur in next 24 hours. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Jaipur girl raped in Pushkar by guide.description: A Jaipur girl who came to see Pushkar was allegedly raped by a tourist guide in Ajmer. She filed a report with the Civil Lines police station on Thursday. Police are searching for the accused. According to police, the girl came to visit Pushkar on May 7 and offered prayers in the Brahma Temple where she met one Jevan Mali alias Jai, a tourist guide. On Wednesday night, the accused raped her in a hotel room. The girl has alleged that accused also took Rs 18,000 from her. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Engineering stream likely to fill 50% se.description: JAIPUR: Engineering colleges are expecting to fill 50% seats in Rajasthan. Rajasthan Engineering Admission Process(REAP) are upbeat over the responses in the ongoing admission process. Last year, for around 40,000 seats, less than 15,000 applications were received. Till June 7, the body has received 7000 applications against the figure of 2000 last year in the first seven days of the admission process. As per experts, one of the reasons for less number of applicants last year was lower awareness among students regarding the examination and its benefits. This year, officials said that they have been promoting the examination by advertising on radio, television, newspapers and even sent officials to promote it within government school students. Sandeep Kumar, convener of the REAP, 2019 examination, said, “Last date of filling the form is June 29. Till June 7, we have already received 7,000 applications and the number is increasing every day. This is really a positive sign as last year by this date only 2,000 forms were received.” Due to the low turnout of students, government has been attempting various methods to attract more students. In 2017, one of the reasons for less number of applicants was the condition to deposit of advance amount of Rs 10,000 (refundable) along with the form fees of Rs 700. However, this was changed in 2018 and students were able to directly apply by depositing form fees. Earlier, exam was conducted for selection but now candidates are selected on the basis of JEE Mains and Advance rank An institute round is also conducted for any remaining seats where students can directly apply to the college of their choice. An official on condition of anonymity said that less number of students are opting for engineering because of low rate of placements in the field. “In Rajasthan, students opt for civil, electrical and mechanical engineering due to the scope available in government jobs. In other branches of engineering, placements are not as good as most companies prefer to hire engineers from Bangalore and there is no mechanism to hire graduates from Rajasthan colleges,” said the official. For mechanical engineering, equipment is costlier than other streams, hence, investment in infrastructure is poor. Punneet Sharma, an academician said that this year the trend is shifting and serious students are opting for Computer Science and Information technology due to the new developments in Artificial Intelligence. Rajasthan likely to witness monsoon by J.description: JAIPUR: Irrespective of the delay in the onset of monsoon in Kerala, the IMD said that its progress is satisfactory so far and it is expected to arrive in Rajasthan by June 22. Monsoon is expected to cover the entire state by July 1. Authorities said that increase in humidity, which has gone up to 75% from 18%, is also a good sign that makes things conducive for the onset of south west monsoon. Rajasthan in the past had witnessed monsoon rainfall on June 17 and June 20 in 2019 and 2018, respectively, and IMD said that the state can expect onset of monsoon by last week of June. By July first week, south west monsoon is likely to be widespread when state capital Jaipur can also expect the monsoon showers. After a prolonged spell of the heat wave conditions the upper air cyclonic circulation and northerly winds have also initiated mild showers and dust storm in almost every parts of the state. “For the onset of monsoon, the humidity plays the role of a catalyst.” Met office, Jaipur refuted the reports saying cyclone Vayu in Gujarat has deterred the south west monsoon winds. “Cyclones are regularly coming on and off to various regions but monsoon winds are strong enough to find their way. It has of course deviated the winds but not deterred them,” said an officer. The state badly needs a good monsoon since last year there was deficit rainfall in at least 14 districts. On Saturday many places in the state received mild showers and dust storm which guided the mercury to take a dip. However, Churu remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 45.8 degree Celsius was recorded. In Jaipur people woke up to a comparatively warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 31.4 degree Celsius was recorded. It was followed by drizzling afternoon as many places in the city witnessed scattered rainfall. A maximum temperature of 39 degree Celsius was recorded in the city. In its forecast Jaipur met office has forecast for mild showers at eastern and western parts of the state including the districts – Ajmer, Bharatpur, Banswara, Udaipur, Rajsamand, Sirohi, Jaipur, Jhunjhunu, Sikar, Sawai Madhopur and Dholpur districts. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Develop wildlife & bird sanctuary in Bar.description: JAISALMER: Rajasthan forest and environment minister Sukhram Vishnoi has directed to make a wildlife and bird sanctuary in Barmer to attract more tourists. The sanctuary will be developed in Jhakharda area of the district, the action plan for which has already been made. Additionally, he directed officials to punish poachers by effectively advocating the wildlife poaching cases. Vishnoi on Saturday held a meeting of department officers. He asked the forest department to plant traditional desert plants instead of thorny plants. He ordered to plant fruit-bearing plants and assured to provide additional budget. He added that the plants planted in the forest area should be numbered so that illegal tree-cutting can be controlled. For conservation of forest land, the minister directed the officials to maintain a record of forest land and regularly conduct inspection. Besides, he asked the food department officers to improve their working style and carry out regular inspections of fair price shops. He said that maximum number of people should be benefitted by the National Food Security Act (NFSA). The forest department officers apprised the minister about shortage of rescue vehicles. District collector Himanshu Gupta assured that vehicles will be provided under border area development programme (BADP). Barmer MLA Mewaram Jain and SP Rashi Dogra were also present in the meeting. Deputy conservator of forests Vikram Pradhan Kesari informed the minister about the working system and progress of the department. Vishnoi also visited the Smriti Van. He also inspected the nursery and planted a sapling. He took information about various types of cactus plants. The minister inspected the rescue center at Dhorimanna and gave necessary directions to department officers for wildlife conservation. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Youths gang-rape woman, blackmail her wi.description: AJMER: A married woman was allegedly gang-raped by two men on the pretext of getting her a free cooking gas connection under a Central government scheme. The men allegedly made videos of the crime and blackmailed the woman for nearly two months before she could muster the courage to report the matter to police on Tuesday. The accused was arrested and video recovered from him on Thursday, while search is on for his accomplice. Deputy superintendent of police, Suresh Kumar Sanwariya is investigating the case. The 25-year-old married woman had gone to a gas agency for free LPG connection under the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana on March 12 this year. At the gas agency, located in her neighbouring village, she met one Mukesh Kumar Deru, who checked the Ujjwala form, said police. “Next day, Mukesh and another person Kishore Swami, resident of Uchariya village, went to the woman’s house. Mukesh told the woman that there was some mistake in the form filled by her,” one of the investigating officers said. As per the FIR in the matter, Mukesh asked the woman to come with him to an E-mitra centre to give her thumb impression. Mukesh said that one of his acquaintances runs an E-mitra centre in Kuchaman and took the woman there. Mukesh and Kishore took the woman to a house in Kuchaman and said that their friend is coming with the thumb impression machine. Kishore then went to the fridge and brought something to drink and offered it to the woman. The woman soon fell unconscious and they both raped her, says the FIR. After an hour when she regained consciousness, Mukesh showed her the video and allegedly threatened her against complaining to anyone. The woman was terrified and went back to her village. She suffered silently but after around 10 days, Mukesh returned to her house and pressurized her for sex. “When I refused, he showed me the video clip and threatened to make it viral on social media,” the rape survivor has said in her FIR. After that, both accused started harassing the survivor. On May 7, Mukesh again came with four people in a pick-up van, stopped the survivor on the road and threatened to show the video to her husband. Once Mukesh left, the woman told her husband about the incident. The couple went to police station and lodged a complaint against the two accused and asked cops to recover the video. Mukesh has been arrested, while search is on for Kishore, police said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

7 child marriages foiled in Rajasthan.description: JAIPUR: On the direction of the members of State Legal Aid Authority, child marriages of six minor girls were stopped in Ajmer and action was taken at 2am on Wednesday. Police later in the morning, filed a complaint in the court against the parents and relatives, and warned them not to marry off their minor children, till they attain the legal age of marriage. Another child marriage was foiled in Baran. Priya (name changed) was two months short of attaining the legal age of marriage. Her bridegroom had already reached her home at Motipura of Chhabra in Baran district. Just before they could tie the knot, a team of district administration reached her home and stopped the marriage. The incident happened late on Tuesday night when tehsildar of Chhabra, Daya Ram Meena, reached the place where the wedding ceremony was being held. “It was a child marriage. It does not matter that she is 17 years and 10 months old. Her family cannot marry her off before she turns 18,” said Meena. When the bridegroom and his family saw that the marriage has been stopped by the district administration officials, they too left the place in a hurry, evading any sort of action against them. The venue of marriage was full of guests and the wedding feast was all ready. Police also reached the spot. “We (tehsildar and the police) have warned Priya’s father not to get her married before she turns 18. They have to wait for two more months, if they want to solemnise her marriage,” said Prem Chand, station house officer, Bavecha. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

16-year-old who died playing video game.description: AJMER: The 16-year-old boy who died of cardiac arrest while playing PUBG on his phone at Neemuch in Madhya Pradesh on Monday, was a resident of Nasirabad. He had completed his Class XII from Kendriya Vidyalaya recently and had gone to attend a family function at Neemuch. Furqan Qureshi, the deceased, was the eldest child in the family that now has two daughters. Fiza, younger sister of Furqan, told the media that her brother had been playing the game from Sunday evening till early Monday and was very tense. “He shouted ‘blast, blast’ and then complained of pain in head and went to bed,” Fiza said. There have been many warnings from different organizations to check children’s obsession with the mobile phone game. “Playing this game for long hours increases blood pressure and can result in cardiac arrest,” said G S Bundela, a doctor working on child psychology. His teachers remember Furqan as a good student. The news of his sudden death left parents in his neighbourhood concerned about their children’s liking for PUBG. “My son is junior to Furqan and he too was playing the game and it was today (on Friday) when I took the mobile phone away from him,” said Arti Bhatia of Nasirabad. She said that even in small cities like Ajmer or towns like Nasirabad, Beawar and Kishangarh, students are too inclined towards this game because their friends in different places or cities can join it online. The news disturbed many parents who had been overlooking their children playing games on smart phones. “There should be a campaign to ban such games because these disturb the thinking of the young, who have stopped physical activities like playing games in open fields or streets,” said Kirti Pathak Sharma, organizer of United Ajmer, an NGO for better health. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. Alcoholic man found dead inside wardrobe.description: AJMER: An alcoholic man was found dead inside a wardrobe in his home on Wednesday, two days after he went missing post an argument with his wife on Monday evening. A case has been registered by the police. According to police, Rajesh Kumar Koli of Dholabhata was a habitual drinker and was an addict, and as per the neighbours, he would come home drunk often and would fight with his wife. According to his wife Sapana, on Monday late evening, he came home heavily drunk and had an argument with her. He then went inside but Sapana did not find him in the room. On Tuesday, she waited for Rajesh to return and when he didn’t return till the evening, she asked about his whereabouts from all his friends and thought he may have gone away somewhere in a fit of anger. But on Wednesday, when she opened the wardrobe in her room, she found her husband ‘asleep’ in the lower shelf of the wardrobe and he did not move after her repeated nudges. She called the police and it was found that Rajesh was dead. Police said that after the fight with his wife on Monday evening, Rajesh went inside the room and fell asleep in the wardrobe, as he was heavily drunk, and later died there. The dead body of the deceased has been sent for the post-mortem and police are investigating. Police said that there were several other cases pending against the deceased. Showers, dust storm guide mercury down a.description: JAIPUR: Mild showers, dust storm and hailstorm guided the mercury to take a dip across the state on Saturday. However, the Met office said that the spell will vanish and the temperatures are set to soar from Sunday onwards. Barmer was the hottest place in state where a maximum temperature of 40 degrees Celsius was recorded. Most of the places in eastern and western Rajasthan witnessed cooler mornings following overnight rainfall. Till 8.30am on Saturday, Bikaner had received 40mm rain and was followed by Sikar with 30mm rain. Many places witnessed rainfall varying from 20mm to 10mm. Thereafter, the rainfall activity vanished except for mild dust storms at some places. Jaipurites witnessed the coldest morning of summer so far as a minimum temperature of 22.4 degrees Celsius, 5 degrees below normal, was recorded. Also, the afternoon recorded the lowest maximum temperature of the season at 36.4 degrees Celsius. Dip in temperatures to this extent is very rare, especially in the month of May. “During May, the city’s maximum temperatures vary from 41-45 degrees Celsius. However, this year Jaipur witnessed maximum temperatures between 35.5-41 degrees Celsius in May,” said a Jaipur Met official. Barmer was followed by Jaisalmer with a maximum temperature of 39 degrees Celsius, Kota 38.9, Bikaner 37.4, Udaipur 36.8, Ajmer 36.4, Jodhpur 36, Sriganganagar 35.7 and Churu recorded 35.5 degrees Celsius. Meanwhile, dust storms continued in Ajmer and Bhilwara on Saturday. Jaipur Met office said western disturbances and upper air cyclonic circulation have vanished which will push mercury up from Sunday onwards. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Now, 33 district in-charges to enjoy adm.description: JAIPUR: The department of administrative reforms, having appointed 33 IAS officers as in-charges of districts, issued an order that they would enjoy administrative powers, i.e., equivalent to that of a secretary of a department. But, they have not been given financial power. On earlier occasions, they could only recommend an action to be taken to the secretary of the respective department. This could be seen as an important decision by the state government following the Congress party’s rout in the state in the recently-concluded Lok Sabha elections. This move will help the state government monitor the progress of various programmes and schemes that affect the people directly. Many Congress ministers and MLAs do believe that lack of proper implementation of various welfare schemes at the district level cost the party heavily in the elections. "The senior secretary-level officers are appointed as in-charge of districts to monitor various ongoing programmes. We have made some changes this time. Each secretary in-charge will now have the power equivalent to the secretary of other departments in a particular way. So, they have been transferred (given) administrative powers, i.e., for a particular district he/she will be the secretary of all departments," Ravi Shankar Srivastava, ACS, administrative reforms and coordination told TOI. “On earlier occasions, they used to monitor various schemes and implementation of statues and refer back to the respective secretaries. Now, they will take a decision as per the standing order or rules of business as if they are the secretary of that department. It has been done to make the system slightly more effective. But, we have not transferred financial power. It will remain as it is,” he added. The secretaries in-charge of districts are Hemant Gera (Ajmer), Bhaskar Sawant (Alwar), Rohit Kumar Singh (Bharatpur), Kunji Lal Meena (Bhilwara), R Venkateswaran (Bikaner), Mugdha Sinha (Bundi), Akhil Arora (Banswara), Beena Pradhan (Barmer), Neeraj K Pawan (Churu), Sanjay Malhotra (Chittorgarh), Vikas Sitaram Bhale (Dungarpur), Suchi Sharma (Dholpur), Gayatri Rathod (Dausa). Ajmer: Woman gets blackmailed by fake Fa.description: AJMER: A fake Facebook account of Rajasthan director general of police Kapil Garg surfaced when a woman from Ajmer on Thursday lodged an FIR at Alwar gate police station, claiming that the person behind the fake account has demanded Rs 50,000 from her and has threatened to frame her in false charges if she didn’t pay. The accused has been chatting on the internet with the woman for last four months and was threatening her into paying the money. The victim then on Thursday registered a case with the police. The fake Facebook account has the photo of Rajasthan police and the police headquarters situated in Jaipur. There are two friends visible on the page and some photos. Verifying the FIR and about the case, superintendent of police Kunwar Rashtradeep said that it was found that the Facebook account was a fake one. He said the police are investigating and the accused will be arrested soon. On the request of the victim, her name was not disclosed. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave unabated in Rajasthan; Sriganga.description: JAIPUR: Heatwave conditions continued to prevail in Rajasthan for the third consecutive day on Thursday. Sriganganagar witnessed the hottest day of the season with temperatures rising to 48 degree Celsius. Jaipur recorded 32.2 degree Celsius, almost 5 degrees above the normal notch. It was followed by a simmering afternoon as the maximum temperature was recorded at 45.2 degree Celsius. In the past three days, the footfall of the patients complaining of heat stroke, diarrhoea and even food poisoning have increased. Doctors are advising patients to increase the intake of water having some salt and sugar in it in order to stay hydrated. In the afternoon roads wore an empty look as people confined themselves to their respective homes and offices. In the evening people thronged at juice corners and refreshed themselves with chilled beverages. The continued rise in the mercury also increased the work of the technicians of the Jaipur Vidyut Vitaran Nigam Limited(JVVNL). “Since Wednesday evening to Thursday morning, we have attended almost 100 calls of abrupt power cuts in various localities. Due to extra load electricity tripped,” said an officer. Many people were going through various apps on their phones to check the weather conditions. “Even at 10.30am the maximum temperature in Jaipur was 44 degree Celsius as per the details through various apps giving,” said Manoj Tanwani who was returning after a walk at Central Park in Jaipur. Sriganganagar was followed by Churu where the maximum temperature was recorded at 47.7 degree Celsius, Bikaner - 47.0, Jaisalmer - 45.7, Kota - 45.4, Jodhpur - 44.6, Barmer - 44, Ajmer 43.8 and 42.8 degree Celsius in Udaipur. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan election results 2019: BJP\u20.description: JAIPUR: With 20 constituencies in Rajasthan recording a higher victory margin for the BJP over the 2014 Lok Sabha elections, it has been observed that the increase in margin has ranged from 1 lakh to over 3.5 lakh votes in as many as 11 constituencies and the highest increase percentage touching up to 115% in Barmer. Bhilwara, not just recorded highest winning margin with BJP's Subhash Chandra Baheria defeating Congress party's Ram Pal Sharma by 6.12 lakh votes (71.6%), it was highest also in terms of increase in margin over 2014 elections. The increase in margin in Bhilwara was of 3.65 lakh votes (85.2%). This was also the highest winning margin ever in the state. The highest-ever turnout in Rajasthan at 66.07%, an increase of 3 per cent over 2014 Lok Sabha elections, also helped the winners achieve larger margins. In Barmer, BJP’s Kailash Choudhury drubbed Congress' Manvendra Singh by a margin of 3.23 lakh votes (59.52%), an increase of 2.36 lakh votes (114.9 per cent) over 2014, when BJP's Sona Ram won by 87,461 votes. In Karauli-Dholpur, where BJP's Manoj Rajoria won by a margin of 97,682 votes, the increase in percentage of victory margin touched 112.8% compared to 2014 elections. Meanwhile, in Banswara, BJP's Kanakmal Katara trumped Congress' Tarachand Bhagora by a margin of 3.05 lakh votes (49.44%), an increase in margin by 2.13 lakh votes (107.5 per cent) over 2014, when Manshankar Ninama won by 91,916 votes. In Ajmer as well, BJP's Bhagirath Chaudhury defeated Congress party's Riju Jhunjhunwala by a margin of 4.16 lakh votes (64.58%), an increase in margin by 2.44 lakh votes (83.1%) over 2014 Lok Sabha elections, when the seat was won by BJP's Sanwarlal Jat by 1.71 lakh votes. Rajputs and minorities key in Nagaur.description: AJMER: Rajputs and minorities will be the deciding factor for Nagaur Lok Sabha constituency which is going to polls on Monday. In 2013 state assembly elections and also in the last Lok Sabha elections of 2014, BJP grew speedily in terms of seat and vote share as Rajputs and minority vote bank shifted towards BJP. However, this time the Rajputs and minorities are not happy as BJP did not field its candidates, instead the saffron party has collaborted with Hanuman Beniwal’s RLP. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

HC notice over rehabilitation of rescued.description: JAIPUR: High court issued notice to the state government over no proper rehabilitation of the rescued bonded labourers from various industrial units in the state. The petition said the district administration has issued certificate to 150 rescued bonded labourers, but no rehabilitation was done. The division bench of chief justice S Ravindra Bhat and Justice Prakash Gupta issued notice on a PIL by Nirmal Goran. The notice was issued to chief secretary, deputy secretary ministry of labour and employment, district collector Baran, Ajmer, Jhunjhunu, Udaipur. With the help of the district administration, the National Campaign Committee for Eradication of Bonded Labour and Human Rights Law Network jointly rescued nearly 150 bonded labourers in the last two years, said Tarachand Verma, counsel for the petitioner. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Inmate kills caretaker of drug rehab cen.description: JAIPUR: A 42-year-old caretaker of a drug di-addiction centre in Karni Vihar was murdered after he stopped an inmate from smoking bidi Friday morning. The police arrested the accused identified as Mohammad Muntajeer (35) a resident of Kacchi Bassti in Kanota area the city. He was admitted to the centre on Tuesday to help him wean off drugs and smoking. However, his urge only aggravated. The police said that the accused had asked caretaker Benjamin to give a bidi but Benjamin declined and warned him not to smoke or take drugs anywhere inside the centre premises. An agitated Muntajeer decided to kill Benjamin for trying to stop him. “On Friday morning, he woke up early in the morning and strangulated Benjamin,” added SHO, Dharam Raj Choudhary. Benjamin was a native of Ajmer district. According to Choudhary, the accused used a piece of cloth to kill Benjamin. “The victim had been working at this centre for past five years. He used to work here to ensure that inmates do not go back to taking drugs and tobacco,” Choudhary said. The employees of the centre told cops that Muntajeer was a trouble inmate ever since he had joined the group. “The accused did not want to reform and found ways to smoke bidi or chew tobacco. He also used to take other sorts of drugs,” said the official. The police said that they have sought his criminal records. “The accused’s family members had taken him to the rehabilitation centre when they saw his condition fast deteriorating,” the official added. The police informed TOI that Benjamin’s body was handed over to the family following post-mortem. An FIR was registered against the accused in the connection at Karni Vihar police station. It was third murder in three days in the city. Earlier in Chitrakoot, a 25-year-old youth was killed by his friends when an argument broke out between them on Thursday. Similarly, on Wednesday an elderly woman was killed after she was strangulated by an accused identified as Ashok. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Why sewerage project for Ajmer, Pushkar.description: JAIPUR: A division bench of Rajasthan High Court questioned the state government on the delay of sewerage project meant for Ajmer and Pushkar cities which is pending for the past 10 years.The Bench, while expressing concern over the nullahs polluting the Anasagar Lake, asked the state government to expedite the project and also penalize those who are responsible for polluting the lake. However, Ajmer Development Authority (ADA) in its reply said that they will complete the project in this financial year. The court expressed its displeasure on the delay of the sewerage plant on a petition filed by common cause society. On Monday, M S Singhvi, advocate general (AG), government of Rajasthan submitted the compliance report in which it was stated that the whole work relating to the sewerage plant would be completed by 2020. The court was informed that till date 11,000 sewerage connection have been given and 10,000 more connections to be given. “Every household would be covered with this project and all the drains would be connected with the sewerage treatment plant (STP),” said Ajmer Development Authority, adding out of the 11 drains polluting the Anasagar 2 have already been closed. ADA also maintained that people in Pushkar and Ajmer are not showing their interest in taking the sewerage connection. The Ajmer-Pushkar Sewerage project has an estimated cost of Rs 112 crore and it will bring a sewerage network of 95 kms. Responding to the compliance report and take of ADA authorities, the bench comprising Justice Mohammad Rafiq and Justice NS Dhadda said that the work of sewerage project for Ajmer and Pushkar is in progress for the past 10 years. “Why it is delayed and the work is going on a slow pace. The authorities should take action as per the provision of pollution control board to check pollution,” said the court. The next date of hearing in this matter is August 6. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Break supply chain of drugs to Ajmer, Pu.description: JAIPUR: In a suo motu cognizance on the rampant supply of drugs and narcotics in Ajmer and Pushkar, a division bench of Rajasthan High Court directed the state government to unearth the racket of narcotics supply in Ajmer and Pushkar. The court has further directed Ajmer police to find out from where the drugs are coming into Ajmer and has asked to take stern action to break its supply chain. The court comprising Justice M Rafiq and N S Dhaddha made directions on its suo motu cognizance. The court also observed that it is learnt that the drugs and narcotics are coming from Neemach and a result-oriented strategy is needed to unearth these rackets and break their supply chain. In the previous hearing on March 28, the court had asked the state government to appoint a psychologist-cum-counsellor at the de-addiction centre of Ajmer, who can facilitate the teenagers and the younger generation who have gotten addicted to drugs. Then the court had also maintained that the election code of conduct won’t affect the appointment and had asked the state government to file the compliance report. Expressing concern over the drugs trade in Ajmer’s Dargah Bazaar and Pushkar, the court had also asked the SP, Ajmer to monitor the situation and to take necessary action. The advocate general on behalf of the government, informed the court that the said appointment of the psychologist has already been made and the government had also registered many cases in the recent past. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Doctors\u2019 strike: No OPD services in.description: JAIPUR/UDAIPUR/AJMER/KOTA: Health services remained crippled in the state as government and private doctors went on a 24-hour strike from 6am on Monday in support of Indian Medical Association (IMA)’s call for nationwide medical bandh. There are 40,000 doctors in the state, working in government and private hospitals. “No OPD services were provided by doctors in the 2,900 government hospitals and health centres. Only emergency services were available. However, doctors conducted post-mortems,” said Dr Ajay Chaudhary, president, All Rajasthan In-Service Doctors Association (ARISDA), a body of doctors posted in rural areas and district hospitals. Health minister Raghu Sharma said, “We have deployed AYUSH doctors practicing Ayurveda, Unani, Homoeopathy in district hospitals along with nursing staff to take care of the patients as an alternative measure.” However, the alternative measures failed to provide much relief to the patients. In Ajmer’s JLN Hospital, patients had to wait for their turn in serpentine queue of patients for registration. But there was no doctor in the OPD. No operation was conducted in the hospital and even patients going to different government hospitals were forced to come to JLN Hospital. At least six serious patients had to be rushed to Jaipur’s SMS hospital from Ajmer’s JLN Hospital for treatment. In JLN Hospital there was long queue of patients early Monday morning where patients got the receipt but there was no doctor in the OPD. The senior doctors came out to help the crowd but it took hours for patients to get their turn. Besides Ajemer, medical and health services were also badly hit in Udaipur division as doctors refrained from duties. Hundreds of patients during the OPD hours had to leave without any treatment as 350 resident and senior doctors were not on duty at the government MB Hospital here in Udaipur. The doctors took out a rally from the hospital campus to the collectorate raising slogans against increasing attacks on the medical practitioners. However, surgeries had to be postponed for the day. Doctors tied bandage on their foreheads and protested against the Bengal incident in the state. At Chittorgarh, delivery operation cases and major surgeries were badly affected and only those patients requiring immediate medical care were taken in. Emergency OPD functioned with the help of the nursing staff while 56 doctors posted at the district hospital remained on strike. The OPD services in hospitals in Kota region witnessed medical care of indoor patients, emergency unit in hospitals attached to New Medical College hospital in Kota continued without any disturbance and the surgeries upon serious patients were also conducted. However, 2,200 doctors attached with ARISDA and IMA had been on strike in hospitals across Hadouti region comprising Kota, Bundi and Jhalawar district. The medical and health services in OPD as well as in indoor, emergency wards continued undisturbed in Maharao Bheem Singh (MBS) Hospital in Kota, said Dr Naveen Saxena, superintendent, MBS Hospital. Faculties took the charge of OPD in MBS Hospital while nine out of 14 surgeries were conducted here. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. Mother saves 1-yr-old daughter from fire.description: AJMER: A mother was seriously burnt when she tried to save her one-year-old daughter, who was surrounded by fire inside the kitchen. The Clock Tower police are investigating the matter and took the mother to JLN Hospital. As per the police, Ladali (27), a resident of Per Road of Shisha Khan was cooking on Sunday. She went out of the kitchen for some work while the cooking gas was on. Her one-year-old daughter Nimit was playing in the kitchen. When she returned, she found that things inside the kitchen were on fire and Nimit was in the centre of the blaze. She ran to save her and got burnt badly but succeeded to save the child. The fire brigade was called. The cooking gas might have leaked and flames went all around the kitchen, said the police. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan: Here, the cemetery gives you.description: JAIPUR: Once a bustling community at Abu Road, today the word ‘Jew’ fails to ring a bell amongst the local populace. So, the only way to find the Jewish cemetery in the city is to ask for the Christian graveyard. “No one from the community exists anymore. Once the population of Jews was around 150-200. But most of them migrated to Israel or other parts of India seeking better opportunities,” says Ratan Bennett holding onto the rusted gate of the Jewish cemetery with a ‘Star of David’ on it. Ratan Bennett (70) is the only person in the city with a Jewish heritage. Born as Abbey Gail Jared in Abu city, she was a Jew before converting to Christianity after her marriage. With only eight graves, the Jewish cemetery has no boundary wall. The land surrounding the cemetery is full of wild plants and thorny bushes. The epitaphs are in Hebrew and English and only state the name and date of death of the person. The oldest grave dates back to 1904. “Abu Road was one of the biggest railway junctions in the British era. Jews, have always been an educated community who settled here to work in the railways. Earlier, the boundaries of this cemetery were intact. Some graves used to have beautiful statues of a woman reading from the Torah (Jewish religious scripture) but slowly due to encroachment and neglect it is now in a dilapidated condition. Around 40 years back, my uncle was the last Jew in the city who migrated to Israel,” recalled Ratan. Ratan’s maternal grandfather who was a guard in railways is buried at the Abu Road cemetery and her paternal grandfather is buried at another Jewish cemetery in Ajmer. These are the only two places to have Jewish cemeteries in Rajasthan. Like on Abu Road, Jews settled in Ajmer were also in the railways. Once a flourishing community, now there are no more Jews left in Rajasthan. As per the 2001 census, one Jew was recorded to be living but no one knows his whereabouts. Migration towards Israel started after its formation in 1948. As per Hansey Timoty (42), a Christian, who is the fourth generation of his family taking care of the Jewish cemetery in Ajmer, the last person buried there was in 1962. “This is the grave of a six-year-old girl who died in an accident. Her father was in railways before migrating to Israel in 1965. Since then, some of her relatives and others have come to pay a visit once in a while. Otherwise, even the municipal authorities of Ajmer have no clue about this place,” said Hansey. Like Abu Road, Ajmer Jewish cemetery is bordering with the CNI Church Christian Graveyard at Christian Ganj. Built around the same time as Abu Road cemetery, the Ajmer Jewish cemetery has 46 graves and is in shambles with no one to look after it. At its peak, Jews were 250–300 in number before migrating to Israel. At present, both the cemeteries are looked after by the Jewish community settled in Ahmedabad. Joint secretary of the Magen Abraham Synagogue (Jewish place of worship) Jacob Robin Srigawkar while talking to TOI expressed concern about the fate of two cemeteries. Heatwave continues, Met says \u2018mercu.description: JAIPUR: Heatwave conditions further aggravated in the state on Monday when majority of places witnessed maximum temperature of 41 degree Celsius and above. There was also a rise in the minimum temperature which was almost 4 degrees above the normal notch. Churu remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 45 degree Celsius was recorded, the Met reports said. Attributing the continued rise in mercury to the active northerly winds and vanishing of upper air cyclonic circulation and westerly winds, the Jaipur Met office said that the mercury will continue to take an upward swing in the state in the next couple of days. Jaipurites woke up to a comparatively warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 29.5 degree Celsius, almost 2 degrees above the normal notch was recorded. It was followed by a sultry afternoon as a maximum temperature of 42 degree Celsius accompanied with 55 per cent humidity was witnessed.  Churu was followed by Bikaner where a maximum temperature of 44.9 degree Celsius was recorded, Kota 44.7, Jaisalmer 44.2, Barmer 44.1, Jodhpur 43.6, Sriganganagar 43.5, Ajmer 42.9 and 41.4 degree Celsius in Udaipur. In its forecast, Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state for the next couple of days. Heatwave conditions will further aggravate in the next 24 hours. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" CISCE Class XII results: 5 from same sch.description: JAIPUR/AJMER: Five students who share the same school have secured all top three ranks in Indian School Certificate Examinations (ISC) class XII results announced on Tuesday. The first position among them was shared by two students. Aditi Chhaparia scored 99.50% (best of four) in Commerce stream, while Ningombam Tampha Chanu stood first in Humanities by scoring 99.50%. The second rank is secured by Navreet Kaur who scored 98.75%. The third position is again shared by two students: Lubna Malhotra and Reetika Shah who scored 98.25% each. All these five students are from Mayo College Girls School, Ajmer. Top performers from Children’s Academy School in cityWhile in the class X result of ICSE, Rohit Kumar of St. Mary School in Sikar stood first by sescuring 97.80%. He was followed by Aameshi Godara of Mayo College Girls School who scored 97.40%. The third slot is grabbed by another student of St. Mary School, Sikar Sakshi Choudhary. Jaipur toppers in the class XII exam include — Nikhil Shahani who scored 96.2% (Science), Gurucharan Singh Vaid who scored 95.4% to stand second, and Gautam Mittal who scored 95.2% to stand third. The trio is from Mayura School. Exams of class X were conducted from February 22 to March 25 and exams of class XII were conducted from February 4 to March 25 this year. According to the board, total one lakh 84 thousand and 253 students across the country appeared in these exams, in which 98.51% are declared passed. The passing percentage of girls is 98.95% and of boys is 98.15%. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Probe begins in Ajmer custodial death ca.description: AJMER: A theft accused, who was found dead in Pisangan police station area of the district on Monday night, was cremated amid heavy presence of security forces in his village Kalesera on Tuesday. Being a custodial death, a judicial inquiry has been initiated to find the cause of death of the man identified as Mangilal. Police had arrested him on Monday afternoon. Pisangan SHO Laxman Singh and five policemen, who were on duty at the time of Mangilal’s death, have been suspended, while the remaining staff of the police station has been sent to police lines. Mangilal’s body was handed over to the family after the post-mortem was conducted by a medical board appointed by the judicial committee on Tuesday morning. The body was taken directly to Kalesera village, where the elder brother of the deceased performed the last rites. Heavy police force was present to control any untoward incident. According to police, Mangilal was arrested on charges of theft in a temple on Monday afternoon and was put in the police lock-up. Later in the night, when the duty guard went to check on the accused in custody, the lock-up was found empty, claimed the police. The duty guard opened the cell and went inside the bathroom where Mangilal was found hanging from the ceiling, police said. As per the police, Mangilal used the bedsheet given to him to sleep on, to commit suicide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Take custody of mentally ill man: Police.description: AJMER: In first-of-its-kind case, the police directed relatives of a mentally ill person roaming for food on the streets of Beawar town of Ajmer on Wednesday to arrange for his treatment. The legal aid authority asked every police station to verify if any lunatic or mentally ill person is roaming in their jurisdiction. If any such person is found then it is the duty of that police station to take custody of that patient and arrange for treatment under Mental Health Care Act, 2017. All districts are directed from State Legal Aid Authority to identify these people roaming aimlessly in colonies and arrange for their treatment and maintenance. President of district authority and district and sessions judge Vinod Kumar Bharwani got the information that a mentally ill Gop Motwani (24) is roaming in Pushkar Ganj colony of Beawar. The authority directed the Beawar police to arrange for the maintenance and treatment of the ill. The police found that his elder brother Govind Das lives at Sendra Road with his family. The police complained against Das in court and it instructed Govind to take care of his brother. It ordered him to provide food, shelter and treatment to Motwani at a government hospital. Secretary of the authority and additional district and sessions judge Shakti Singh Shekhawat said that it is the duty of the state to provide treatment and shelter to mentally ill people. There is a difference between lunatic and mentally ill and such people can become a threat to others. Such patients have the right to mental health care services provided and funded by the government. Shekhawat directed the police to take care of such people and instruct their families to access treatment as per the law, “The motive is to bring such people back in society,” added Shekhawat. Rain, dust storm bring some respite from.description: JAIPUR: Moderate rainfall and dust storm provided the elusive relief to the state reeling under severe heat wave conditions for the past fortnight. A drop of almost five degrees Celsius on an average was reported across the state on Thursday. However, Churu and Sriganganagar were the hottest places with a maximum temperature of 44.5 degrees Celsius. Attributing the rainfall and dust storm to the active northerly winds and upper air cyclonic circulation, the Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will continue in the state for the next couple of days. The ongoing rain spell in the state has also become a catalyst for the increased humidity levels which are conducive for monsoon rain. People in Jaipur witnessed a warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 28.2 degrees Celsius was recorded in the city. It was followed by a cloudy and pleasant afternoon as a maximum temperature of 36.3 degrees Celsius was recorded. For the first time in the season, the city recorded maximum temperature below 40 degrees. Farmers in the city outskirts were elated as rainfall prior to the monsoon is always considered a blessing for sowing seeds. Some places in the city witnessed scattered rainfall which also guided the mercury to take a dip. The ongoing rain spell has increased the humidity upto 72 percent. The Jaipur Met office, however, denied that the spell was related to cyclone Vayu. Many places in the state received rainfall varying from 70mm to 10mm. Mount Abu (Sirohi) received 70 mm rain, the highest in the state on Thursday. Churu and Sriganganagar were followed by Bikaner where a maximum temperature of 43.1 degrees Celsius was recorded, Jaisalmer 41.2, Kota 39.5, Barmer 38.9, Jodhpur 37.6, Jaipur 36.3, Udaipur 34.5 and a maximum temperature of 33 degrees Celsius was recorded in Ajmer.
