Heatwave hits life in parts of Rajasthan.description: JAIPUR: Blistering heat wave affected normal life in parts of Rajasthan where Bikaner recorded the highest temperature of 45.6 degrees Celsius on Tuesday. Jaipur Met office has said the heat wave conditions would intensify in eastern and western parts of the state in the next couple of days. Continued rise in mercury has further aggravated problems related to drinking water and power supply. In some parts of the state including Barmer, Ajmer, Bhilwara, Jodhpur, Churu, Bikaner and Jaisalmer, people are not getting drinking water on a regular basis. The district collectors concerned are arranging for water tankers for the public. In Jaipur, a minimum of 29.6 degrees Celsius was recorded, almost two degrees above normal. The city witnessed the hottest day of the season so far with maximum temperature of 43.2 degrees Celsius. Several colonies also witnessed abrupt power cuts due to increased usage in city. Bikaner was followed by Sriganganagar and Jaisalmer where a maximum temperature of 45.2 degrees Celsius was recorded, Churu 45.1, Kota 45 Barmer 44.6, Jodhpur 44.5, Ajmer 43.5 and a maximum of 41.8 degrees Celsius was recorded in Udaipur. The heat wave conditions will further aggravate in the state in the next 24 hours, Jaipur Met office said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Girls shine again in Ajmer region.description: AJMER: Girls once again outperformed boys in the Ajmer region in CBSE Class X results, which were announced on Monday. The girls logged a pass percentage of 97.34% compared to 94.91% for boys. Overall, the figure stood at 95.89%, which is 3% higher than last year, said a CBSE official. In Ajmer region, Arihant Jha from Jamnagar in Gujarat and Taru Jain from Jaipur shared the first rank with 499 marks. “I never expected to score 100 in four subjects. This success has brought me closer to my dream of pursuing honours in economics from Delhi University,” said Jain, a student of St Angela Sophia School in Jaipur. As per the merit list released by CBSE, six students made it into the top three ranks in Rajasthan. Jaipur’s Shreya Khandal of Maheshwari Girls Public School stood second. She scored 496 out of 500 marks. The third sport was shared by four students—Shruti Sharma of St Angela Sophia Sr Sec School, Jaipur, Mehul Kochar of Shri Jain Public School in Bikaner, Rajat Choudhary of Tagore International School, Bhadra in Hanumangarh and Riya Choudhary of Bakhshi’s Springdales Sr Sec School, Borkhera, Kota. They all scored 495 marks as per the merit list released by the CBSE. Giving details, Sanjeev Das of CBSE, Ajmer region, said the girls’ pass percentage is higher than the boys. From across the country, students from Thiruvananthapuram fared the best with a pass percentage of 99.85%, followed by Chennai (99%) and Ajmer (95.89%). Students from 2,545 schools of Ajmer region which includes Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Dadra and Nagar Haveli had registered for exams. From a total of 1,94,826 students who had registered, 1,94,303 appeared for the exam. Of these, 1,84,183 students passed the exams. He said that 7,126 students who had failed can reappear for the exam after a month. Kendriya Vidyalayas topped in the exam with a pass percentage of 99.3%, followed by Jawahar Navodaya schools at 98.72%. Private schools ranked third with 94.95% and government schools stood at 93.87%. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
